p: This article finds that China has embedded the construction of its new international identity in leading global climate governance in the Paris era and beyond. This changing identity construction is both reflected in and partly constituted by the way China has come to take up its new leadership role in GCG. Climate change governance has become one of China’s prototypical discursive frames in constructing its new international identity. China has reconstructed issues of climate justice and GCG has become an important platform where China seeks to represent itself as a leading actor and share leadership with other major powers.
